title: Astros owner Jim Crane writes apology letter to SI reporter for initial response to Brandon Taubman story
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Trysta Krick breaks down all the action from Game 4 of the World Series where the Astros evened the series at 2-2 by beating the Nationals 8-1. USA TODAY

Nearly a week after calling a Sports Illustrated story “misleading and completely irresponsible,” the Houston Astros have retracted their initial response and apologized in writing to the article’s author.

“On behalf of the entire Astros organization, I want to personally apologize for the statement we issued on Monday October 21st,” team owner Jim Crane wrote to Stephanie Apstein. “We were wrong and I am sorry that we initially questioned your professionalism. We retract that statement, and I assure you that the Houston Astros will learn from this experience.”

Apstein’s first-person account of the activities inside the Astros' clubhouse after they won the American League pennant included a description of Houston’s assistant general manager Brandon Taubman yelling, “Thank God we got Osuna! I’m so (expletive) glad we got Osuna!” toward a group of female reporters, one of whom was wearing a purple domestic-violence awareness bracelet.

Osuna, the Astros' closer, was serving a 75-game suspension in 2018 for violating Major League Baseball's domestic violence policy when the Astros acquired him from the Toronto Blue Jays.

After initially claiming Apstein attempted to “fabricate a story” and receiving almost universal criticism when other witnesses emerged, the Astros fired Taubman as MLB began its own investigation.

Commissioner Rob Manfred said Saturday the findings of MLB’s investigation will not be complete until after the conclusion of the World Series.
description: Nearly a week after calling SI story “misleading and completely irresponsible,” the Astros have retracted initial response and apologized to author.
